New Records: Cody Bellinger's 14th homer of the season was a two-run shot
Key Match Events: Cody Bellinger homered to cap a seven-run second inning
Dylan Crews homered for the second consecutive game for Washington
Washington pushed three runs across in the ninth inning against relievers Tyson Miller and Drew Smyly
Pre-Game Insights: Cubs manager Craig Counsell said the team has scored 80 runs in its last eight games
Washington manager Dave Martinez said Jake Irvin was effective when he kept the ball down
Post-Match Reflections: Cody Bellinger said the team has been loud and has been hitting a lot of barrels
Washington pushed three runs across in the ninth inning but fell short
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs have won 18 of 26 since July 31
Washington was denied its first three-game winning streak since July 19-21
Others: Jake Irvin tied a career high by allowing seven runs
